meanings.definition: Damage the purity or integrity of (verb)
meanings.sent1: I accidentally sully my white shirt with spaghetti sauce.
meanings.sent2: Please do not sully the clean floor with muddy shoes.
meanings.sent3: He tried to sully her reputation, but no one believed his lies.
meanings.sent4: The scandal sullied the company's once pristine image.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti sullied the beauty of the historic building.

meanings.sent1: The sully on the mirror made it hard to see clearly.
meanings.sent2: She carefully cleaned the sully off the silver necklace.
meanings.sent3: The little girl's hands were covered in sully after playing outside.
meanings.sent4: The sully on the painting was a reminder of its age and history.
meanings.sent5: The sully on the window distorted the view of the garden outside.
